TopicTitle: The BiPlane - A Stock All-Around Plane

Articles.Content:
The BiPlane is an all-around, general purpose airplane designed for stability and ease of flight.

It has a decorative, non-functional propeller on the nose and is powered by a clipped jet engine in the tail.

It is extremely stable and can fly upside down for extended periods of time, but is difficult to land due to it's tail-dragger landing gear configuration.

I found after a tower-buzzing accident that it can fly stable with 1/3 of the wings missing.

Due to that accident, all BiPlanes are equipped standard with a ballistics parachute, activated by staging.

It is also a very good transporter, being able to fly stable with 10 tons of rocket fuel strapped to the wings.

You can get your very own BiPlane by clicking the link below:

http://www./download/mnq5qtpqe5eb8q2/BiPlane.craft
